column4: Bakelite, the first fully synthetic thermoset, was reported by Leo Baekeland using phenol and formaldehyde.
Waldo Semon and the B.F. Goodrich Company developed a method in 1926 to plasticize PVC by blending it with various additives.
Neoprene produced for the first time in DuPont
RCA Victor introduced their vinyl-based Victrolac compound for records. Vinyl records have twice the groove density of shellac records with good sound quality.
Nylon is first used for bristles in toothbrushes. It features at the 1939 worlds fair and is used in famously used in stockings in 1940
Polytetrafluoroethylene (commonly known as teflon), discovered by Roy Plunkett at DuPont.
Polyethylene terephthalate (PET) is discovered at the Calico Printers' Association in Britain. Expanded polistyrene first produced[5]
DuPont begin the manufacture of polyester.
J. Paul Hogan and Robert L. Banks from Phillips polymerized propylene for the first time to produce polypropylene
Polycarbonate independently developed by Hermann Schnell at Bayer and Daniel Fox at General Electric
Polypropylene was discovered by Giulio Natta with production starting in 1957
Kevlar developed at DuPont by Stephanie Kwolek
Polyester film stock replaces cellulose acetate for photographic film and computer tapes.
